fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
# integrate JIRA with Bitbucket via DVCS plugin
# add smart commit in Bitbucket with multi-line. Eg:
{code}
TEST-1 #comment will need review
#time 1h need more write up 
#start-progress
{code}
# synchronize JIRA with the repository
# (Limitation) in JIRA issue, only comment will be added to the issue. The issue will not have log time or transited to a different status.


To be clear, smart commits in single line will trigger all action.
fields.summary: Multi-line Smart Commit should trigger action in JIRA

fields.description:
Assigning to PM for feedback.

Current implementation bi-passes GitHub's permissions. Only the person linking the repository to a project needs to have permissions for the private repo, once this is done any person that can view JIRA issues can view github's private commits.
fields.summary: User viewing commits for an issue should be asked to authenticate with github if the repository is private

fields.description:
It appears that the DVCS connector is polling for new commits once an hour:
!dvcs~.png!
This is far too long an interval (perhaps chosen to avoid DDOS'ing bitbucket?), and is leading developers to think the integration is broken. We use a local Github Enterprise, and would like to reduce the interval.

Please add a setting for this in the DVCS config page.


--- 
As for workarounds, editing the service through the web UI doesn't work (JRA-36774), and editing the service interval in the database and restarting doesn't work either, as something resets the interval to 60 minutes on start.
fields.summary: Allow configurable refresh times for commit checks

fields.description: Currently the DVCS Connector shows commits from oldest at the top to newest at the bottom. It would be nice to be able to flip that around to newest at the top.
fields.summary: Add ability to change commit order to newest first

fields.description:
From: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/GHC/Clarifications+from+PM

Recommendation: "No commits/changesets found on repository".
fields.summary: Show message when syncing a repo that does not have any commits yet

fields.description:
We use JIRA with Bitbucket's pull request process and the DVCS auto-transition of issues (in our JIRA workflow from In Progress -> Review when a PR is opened) generally works very well for us.

However we have occasions where we will keep a feature under development on its own feature branch, separate from master and/or one of our release branches for a significant amount of time.  In order to keep these feature branches "fresh", we occasionally will do a pull request *from* the master branch into the feature branch.  In these cases we have sometimes observed that the DVCS auto-transition incorrectly transitions "in progress" issues that were noted in commits on *master* (and that we're previously merged in via PR, but still have additional work or merges in order to complete, hence they are still "in progress") to review, as well as any issue keys for commits on the feature branch, including from merge commits from master.

At the very least, it would be nice if in this scenario, the issue keys in the merge commits were ignored rather than auto transitioning all issues as it has caused some confusion among our developers.

Some more specifics on what we observed can be found in [this service desk case|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-117861]

Please let me know if you have any questions or need more clarification about what we're looking for.

Thanks!
fields.summary: DVCS issue transition improvements for pull requests that merge from master into a feature branch

fields.description: Indexing a repository with more than 9 pages takes an extremely long time to process and brings JIRA Studio to it's knees.  Possibly related to GHC-105.
fields.summary: Improve 'Force Sync' synchronization of large repositories

fields.description:
When adding a new user in JIRA, the DVCS connector is configured to add users to the Developers group of a new OnDemand Bitbucket team by default. This behavior is confusing and causes uses concern over the security of the add-on. Please default to not adding any users to Bitbucket groups without ample explanation that this will happen.

h3. How to change the default
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Configure+Automatic+Team+Invites

The link above shows you have to change the default.
fields.summary: Disable adding users to Bitbucket teams by default.

fields.description:
Bitbucket linkers that have been manually setup for a JIRA instance are overridden / removed when the DVCS synchronisation process runs and are replaced with a regex that matches issue keys that are associated with commits in the repository.

The reasoning behind the current functionality is that creating a linker for a project in JIRA that either does not exist or has no commits will result in the linker url in Bitbucket not resolving to a valid JIRA page.

Manual linker configuration for that same JIRA instance may still be useful however as you could change it to say resolve to an agile board or release based on a different regex. Or you may want a custom project link.
fields.summary: Allow manual configuration of linkers

fields.description:
When attempting to Sync a GitHub respository with the DVCS connector the following stacktrace was seen:
{noformat}
com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:MySQL
	- version:5.5.29-0ubuntu1
	- minor version:5
	- major version:5
Driver:
	- name:MySQL Connector Java
	- version:mysql-connector-java-5.1.25 ( Revision: ${bzr.revision-id} )

com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.create(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.DelegatingActiveObjects.create(DelegatingActiveObjects.java:61)
...
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4185)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4119)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2570)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2731)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2815)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeInternal(PreparedStatement.java:2155)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2458)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2375)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2359)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:105)
{noformat}
* Strict Mode did not do anything as well.  
* Ultimately changing the datatype to 'LONGTEXT' solved this issue. 


{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#a7c4e2 | bgColor=#E7F4FA}
The problem here was that the length of the message in the repository was beyond what the datatype "text" could receive (64k), so making this bigger solved the issue.
{code}
ALTER TABLE 'AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING' MODIFY MESSAGE LONGTEXT;
{code}


{panel}

Can we make this error more descriptive or possibly output the value that is too long in the logs, or even the frontend for the customer to easily understand?
fields.summary: Data Truncation Error Should be More Descriptive

fields.description:
Format could be something like:

<issue_key> #create <description>

Note that only the project key would be meaningful in <issue_key> and any issue number would be ignored. So,

ABC-123 #create This is a new issue.

Would result in a new issue in Project ABC with a description of "This is a new issue." The "123" is ignored.
fields.summary: Add a "create" smart commit message that would create an issue from a commit message.

fields.description:
The "," acts like a delimiter in the smart commit message parser so the only thing being processed in a message such as "code-review-completed,-released-to-qa", is "code-review-completed", and if there are two workflow statuses with that prefix, then the smart commit fails.

It seems that the DVCS smart commit parser uses commas as a delimiter so that you can do things like: "TEST-1 #in-progress, TEST-2 #done".

Can we remove commas as delimiters, and find another way to chain smart commit messages -  maybe a different delimiter that isn't valid in a status could be chosen?
fields.summary: Remove recognition of commas (,) as a delimiter in smart commit messages.

fields.description:
GitHubCommitsTabPanel.java (Line 230)

Usually a project has a number of steady committers, however, right now as we are iterating through each commit, we make a new request to github to fetch the user's details. Caching the user details should help in this case to decrease the number of IO calls.
fields.summary: Cache the user details while iterating over commits

fields.description: Suggestion from the support team. If a repo failed to sync (ie. does not exist, communication went down, bad user/pass) it should indicate its state on the repo page.
fields.summary: Add a visual indication that a repo failed to sync on the table.
Replace property set storage with Active Objects

fields.description: Some of our repos are empty, and the "last commit" line shows up as a blank space. From an admin perspective, it'd be desirable to have those repos marked as "Empty" or something similar, to differentiate "repos that have stuff in them that aren't working" from "sync'd repos" from "repos that are actually empty".
fields.summary: Indicate empty repos in synchronization display
Allow specifying reverse proxy for auto-linked GitHub post-commit hooks

fields.description:
From an admin perspective, it'd be nice to be able to collapse or expand the repositories list on the DVCS account page. With large repos, it can get a bit scrolly.

This would also make it easier to vet the list of organizations/repos to make sure all of the appropriate ones have been added.
fields.summary: Collapse or expand feature on DVCS account admin page

fields.description: In Jira 6.1 creating branches from Jira was added which now provides a structured naming convention to branches. I would like to be able to leave out the issue key from commits and still have the commits show in Jira. While you may not want this to be the default behavior it would be nice if it was an option.
fields.summary: Branch name containing issue key should recognize commits without inserting key in the commit message

fields.description:
GitHub allows users to run their own private copy of GitHub on your own server under you own company.com URL.

If we try to add a repository from such an installation using GitHub-Studio integration you just released I get "Please supply a valid GitHub repository URL." error message.
fields.summary: Support GitHub:FI
Change permissions message to be more clear

fields.description:
When Testers and Release Managers are reviewing issues on JIRA, they often make use of the "Development" information provided by the DVCS connector to BitBucket to assess where in the life-cycle a particular issue is.
!Development_Commit.jpg!
Having the ability to see, at a glance, which Branch a given commit originated from, and a status of that Branch (e.g. is it still open, was it merged with dwefault since the commit, is it closed?) would greatly help them to understand the lifecycle of a commit and the state of default/mainline without having to refer to developers.
fields.summary: Commit Pop-Up to list Branch Name and Status

fields.description:
The DVCS connector works well connecting to code repos, but doesn't seem to support connecting to other types of GitHub data that is backed by a git repo, such as the wiki associated with the repo, which has a different clone URL. For instance, the repo's wiki is:

  git@github:org/admin.wiki.git

while the repo's code is:

  git@github:org/admin.git
fields.summary: Link JIRA to GitHub wiki repo

fields.description:
Now that you've given us the ability to link Github Enterprise into JIRA, we are of course full of exciting suggestions!

The top of the list from my users is a reverse linking of JIRA issues to Github Enterprise commits; that is, the same kind of commit-to-issue link that's happening in JIRA, only on the other end.

This may not be so much a pony as a full-blown horse farm, but it can't hurt to ask. I imagine it would have to involve some sort of trusted-application setup between GHE and JIRA, but it seems like it should be possible.
fields.summary: Reverse linking of JIRA issues within Github Enterprise

fields.description: With very large repositories, GitHub may return a 502 (Server Overloaded) while performing the first synchronization. When this occurs, there should be a way to retry from the last point reached in the synchronization.
fields.summary: When failing, add the ability to retry from the failing point

fields.description: If a user adds multiple repositories for the same project, commits from both repositories may target the same issue. In this case, there is nothing in the commit entry UI that shows from which repository the commit came from.
fields.summary: GitHub commit panel: Include from what repo the commit came from

fields.description:
I other parts of JIRA the pencil icon is used to turn current page/section into edit mode.

Examples:
- HAUP edit user's application access
- JIRA issue edit labels
- JIRA issue edit comment
fields.summary: "Pencil" give visual indication that clicking will turn current screen to edit mode, when in fact will product navigation to another screen

fields.description:
Hello, 

My team is using the cloud versions of JIRA and Bitbucket. I routinely use the `#time` Smart Commit command, but there does not appear to be any way to modify the time remaining to 0.

Optimally, "PROJ-123 blah blah #done #time 30m" would set time remaining to 0 on account of having transitioned to Done, but it would suffice (and be more generally useful) to be able to do something like "PROJ-345 not quite done #time 1h #remaining 3m".

Thanks!
fields.summary: JIRA Smart Commits: #remaining

fields.description: Increase DVCS connector limit on fetching commits into JIRA issues. Currently, it is set to 401 commits which is blocking JIRA users from getting the information.
fields.summary: Increase DVCS connector limit on fetching commits into JIRA issues

fields.description: Bitbucket has Git support now.  Update the plugin to support both Hg and Git BB repos.
fields.summary: Support Git Repositories in Bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, when there is a sync error in the DVCS Connector on OnDemand, an error message like "Error during sync. See server logs." is shown on the "DVCS Accounts" page. However, this message is useless as OD users do not have access to the log.

We should provide more meaningful error messages and helpful instructions about how to handle the error. If the errors are transient, inform the users to wait or retry later. If the errors are permanent, inform the users to contact support.
fields.summary: Provide more meaningful messaging when errors occur on OD

fields.description: e.g. marke JIRA version as released, ...
fields.summary: Plugin could detect maven releases in commits and execute appropriate actions in JIRA

fields.description:
How soon will version 1.3 of JIRA DVCS Connector be released?

In the next week or two, our company is doing a big push to move our code into GitHub Enterprise. The support for GitHub Enterprise was only added recently and it seems like it's only available in the milestone releases so far (DCON-172).

We don't install milestone releases of JIRA plugins, so we would like to know the timeline of when 1.3 will be released so we know how it'll impact us.
fields.summary: Release Date For Version 1.3

fields.description: Both plugins do almost the same. It will be easier to develop if they are shared. It will be easier for users to have only one configuration screen to manage repositories.
fields.summary: Merge jira-github-connector plugin into jira-bitbucket-connector plugin

fields.description:
See https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Plugin+communication+for+6.0+Breaking+Changes

Please read https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+6.0 for more details.

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/2013/02/19/JIRA+6.0+-+The+road+to+getting+Breaking+Changes+to+OnDemand+is+ever+winding

Start with JIRA 6.0-m7
fields.summary: Ensure compatibility with JIRA 6.0 breaking changes

fields.description: This is a studio coding standard. For more information, please contact [~jwilson]
fields.summary: Move CSS style to a stylesheet instead of inline

fields.description: Before repository is added check that it is valid and accessible.
fields.summary: Check the validity of the repository as its added

fields.description:
A user requested the ability to create links to repos via an API. We did not have the API for this plugin documented anywhere. Thus I can not know if this is possible or not. Nor can the user reasonably develop against the API. We should publish a document on this topic, even if it just says "the API is in flux and should not be used" or something along those lines.

This includes in API docs which would be picked up by the REST API browser in the Developer Toolbox Plugin.
fields.summary: Document the REST API

fields.description: It seem user having an issue where hitting this blocker bug ticket: [DCON-348|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/DCON-348] because JIRA 6.1.7 still using DVCS v1.4.2.12. This problem could cause user always need to manually update the DVCS plugin to v1.4.3 .
fields.summary: Update DVCS plugin to the latest version when JIRA is in latest version.

fields.description:
The current documentation on linking Bitbucket with JIRA is using old screen shots of Bitbucket, thus, confusing users who read them:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/getting-started-with-bitbucket-and-jira-cloud-776830280.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Processing+JIRA+Software+issues+with+Smart+Commit+messages

Please update the documentation to reflect the changes in Bitbucket & JIRA Cloud UI.
fields.summary: Update documentation for linking Bitbucket and JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
We need to communicate with github through HTTPS. Github.com server uses SSL certificate which was provided by DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA and certificate from this CA is not in trusted keystore in JDK. Therefore connection to github API throws SSLHandshakeException. 
We have two kinds of possible solutions: 

First-one is to download DigiCert certificate and import it to trusted keystore manualy with keytool utility on every instance where plugin is used. Is that feasable in Studio?

Second-one is to do it by silent way programmatically. But this way may not be very secure as we will just blindly accept any certificate that we get.
	
For now the certificate have to be imported manually.
fields.summary: Import public DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA certificate to cacerts

fields.description:
Issue cloned from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/DCON-35

This is a studio coding standard. For more information, please contact [~jwilson]
fields.summary: Move CSS style to a stylesheet instead of inline

fields.description:
How to connect own Mercurial server and own JIRA server?
via DVCS?

JIRA 6.1.7
fields.summary: How to connect own Mercurial server and own JIRA server via DVCS?

fields.description: When adding new repository check that it doesn't already exists.
fields.summary: Prevent adding duplicate repositories

fields.description: There is a lot of shared design between the BBC and the GHC, we should restructure the BBC to allow for them to share implementation where it makes sense.
fields.summary: Restructure source modules to allow sharing between the BBC and the GHC

fields.description:
A customer has come to me with this change documentation request as this could have saved him. The link to the support ticket is [here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-89041]


*He says:*

Although I have system admin rights, the BitBucket tab would not appear unless I was a member of a project Role that had View Versions rights.

This is clear in hindsight but not obvious. I suggest that the documentation be updated, I re-traced my steps and I would have seen it quite quickly if noted on this page:

https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/BBC/Viewing+Bitbucket+Commits+related+to+a+JIRA+Issue

I suggest adding a "Note" panel after this existing sentence:

Navigate to an issue in a JIRA project that is linked to a
Bitbucket repository. If there are commits that have the
JIRA issue key mentioned in the commit message, it will
show in the Bitbucket tab of the issue.

e.g. add something like this:

Note: The BitBucket tab will only be displayed in the Activity
section for users that have the View Version Control permission.
See Managing Project Permissions (with link).
Thanks, this issue should probably be changed now to a documentation fix.
fields.summary: Please add note to doco

fields.description:
The following enhancement request came through the AOD docs. Recorded here for the customer.

Is there a way to link user accounts on JIRA with user accounts on bitbucket? As an example:

I have the user foo@example.com on bitbucket. I have the user foo with email address foo@example.com in my JIRA instance. When foo@example.com pushes a change to bitbucket, I would like the activity stream in JIRA to understand that this is actually the user foo.
fields.summary: Automatically Link User Accounts on JIRA with User Accounts on bitbucket

fields.description: Allow build plans created by the version of Bamboo within JIRA studio to check out code from repositories hosted on github.
fields.summary: GitHub Integration for Bamboo within JIRA Studio

fields.description:
In DCON-65, a feature was added that uses the BitBucket api to add a commit hook rather than relying on the user to do it.

However, this requires that the user enter credentials that have admin access to the repo into Jira. If I understand correctly, this hook is the *only* thing that requires admin credentials; everything else would work just dandy with mere read access.

My feature request is to make supplying admin credentials optional. If the connector is only given read access, it should nag the user to either supply better credentials or fix the hook themselves.
fields.summary: Allow the user to provide read-only credentials

fields.description: We use Git (+Gerrit +Jenkins) and would love to adopt this plug-in, but we don't want to use GitHub nor do we plan to migrate to GitHub enterprise.
fields.summary: Support git in addition to GitHub/GitHub Enterprise

fields.description:
Currently, the POST-commit hook is designed to be associated with one Jira project to one Git repo.

However, there is a need to allow one post-commit to let multiple Jira project get scanned for commits.

Typically, a big Git repo can have many working projects inside a large folder structure. Jira projects use different folders of that Git repository.
fields.summary: Define a bitbucket POST-COMMIT hook of single Git repository for multiple Jira projects

fields.description:
Example: "ABC-123 #peer-review #comment finally integrated the awesome new user assignment feature. @scald" 

Above example would do the expected comment, move to the Peer Review workflow step, and also assign the issue to me. This feature would make this connector a slam dunk for our daily operations.
fields.summary: Ability to assign user from a commit.

fields.description:
It would be nice if a BB/GH content follows a jira issue when it's moved. 
Maybe picking the issue key (FOOBAR-123) comment from a BB/GH commit and associating with the "id" field from the jiraissue table.
fields.summary: BB/GH data isn't carried over when ticket is moved

fields.description:
h3. Description

Add support for Gitlab hosted privately or publicly.
h3. Workaround

You can either:
 * Use the [free app released by Gitlab|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221011/gitlab-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=installation]. Please notice that *it is now possible to also use the free app to integrate with self-hosted Gitlab*, as documented in: [Install the GitLab.com for Jira Cloud app for self-managed instances|https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/jira/connect-app.html#install-the-gitlabcom-for-jira-cloud-app-for-self-managed-instances]
 * Follow the instructions in [https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/jira.html]
 * Use any of the other app (free or paid) available on our marketplace: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=jira&query=gitlab]
fields.summary: Add support for Gitlab

fields.description:
Currently, our workflow involves developers forking a main repository and then sending pull requests back to the project lead. JIRA is connected to the main repository through this plugin. It appears a sync (post service) is only triggered when pushing commits directly to the main repository.  Accepting pull requests, while it does create a merge commit, does not post back to JIRA.

It would be hugely beneficial if merges were also posted back to JIRA. As it is, we have to force sync all our repositories to pull in commits.
fields.summary: Post back merge commits

fields.description: When an issue is moved all of the linked commit history is removed (as the ID changes) users would like to have the option of keeping that linked commit history when moving the issue.
fields.summary: Allow an issue that's been moved to keep its linked commit history

fields.description: Why can't you add a STASH account?
fields.summary: provide a link to "STASH" in the Manage DVCS account

fields.description:
Provide the functionality to restrict the integration based on repository to project basis.

For example, Project A will only shows commits, pull request, branches, etc. from Repository A. Project B with repository B.
fields.summary: Provide the functionality to restrict the integration based on repository to project basis

fields.description:
When allowing Smart Commits, it is (very) often a problem of mismatching Git/BitBucket email address, and Jira's email address.
The issue is, BitBucket address is almost always a general one that is being used in multiple teams and projects, whereas the Jira's email address is often company specific (a Google Apps address for example).
This can easily be fixed if the feature mentioned in CONF-29835 is implemented (there wasn't a compelling reason earlier to do this feature before, there is now).
fields.summary: Multiple Email addresses to support Smart Commits
demo

fields.description: In addition to being able to modify existing JIRA issue -> commit links
fields.summary: Ability to select relating changeset

fields.description: Expose the commit information cached by the DVCS Connector through an api. Ideally, it would show all information shown in the UI associated with a specific Issue Key(s).
fields.summary: Expose commit information through an api

fields.description: Would like to comment on a JIRA issue and Link to a BitBucket Commit. Ex: "Already fixed [BBi-C-ID]"
fields.summary: Ability to Link Comment to BitBucket Commit

fields.description:
Use the remote API to create the bitbucket post commit hook instead of relying on the use to.

See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BBDEV/Services
fields.summary: Use remote API to create post commit hook
Ability to link pull requests to JIRA issues

fields.description: Users should be able to filter activity streams for commits by repos
fields.summary: Show BitBucket/github pull requests for a select set of repos in activity stream gadget

fields.description:
As I'm tasked with tracking my work against tickets whenever possible, the ability to create a ticket while committing work on an undocumented issue would be of great use to me. 

I imagine the commit message would look something this:
"#create  An undocumented issue"

This would create a ticket and set its summary as "An undocumented issue."

You have my gratitude in advance for your consideration.
fields.summary: Add #create as a smart commit directive

fields.description:
We have 2 Github accounts, and each one have their projects. 
It would be nice to setup Github integration per project.

- Set up *default* Github account
- Set up Github account of a specific project
fields.summary: Ability to setup Github account per project

fields.description: Right now, any BitBucket commits are relegated to the "Development" section of an issue, as well as "Activity", but when you view the "All" tab, you don't see any commit information.  We'd like to see the "All" tab show all activity in chronological order, including the commit activity.  This was a feature we enjoyed from Assembla's Ticket Activity that we migrated from, it showed a better chronological time of all activity - good for managers and devs alike to get caught up.
fields.summary: Allow "All" comment tab, on an issue, to also show inline commits chronologically

fields.description: DVCS Connector could offer to create new repository each time new JIRA project is created
fields.summary: Create new repository when new JIRA project is created

fields.description: Support the ability to use the "Code Committed Condition" (only allow the transition to execute if code either has or has not been committed against the issue) with Git/Mercurial commits.
fields.summary: Support "FishEye" workflow conditions

fields.description: We currently require the user to enter his Bitbucket credentials into the configuration screen, then manually paste a url for the repo in. Once the user has entered his credentials, we should be able to query Bitbucket and return a list of their repos, so that the user can select it from a list rather than manually entering a URL, simplifying the configuration.
fields.summary: provide list of user's repos when choosing project association

fields.description: Customer wants to be able to search for issues that have not had a commit for a certain period of time (or issues that have not had a commit at all).
fields.summary: Search in JIRA for time since last commit

fields.description:
We would like to be able to include a portion of a commit hash (at least 7 leading chars) in a comment in Jira OnDemand and have it automatically link to our Bitbucket installation to that commit.

We currently have Bitbucket linking back to Jira when we include issue identifiers in the commit message, this request is sort of for the reverse.
fields.summary: Link commit hashes in Jira OnDemand comments to Bitbucket

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to trigger status changes for a JIRA issue from GitHub or Bitbucket commit messages. For example, "fixes PONE-23", or "Fix PONE-23"
fields.summary: Trigger status changes for a JIRA issue from GitHub or Bitbucket commit messages.

fields.description: It would be nice if we could associate branches with JIRA issues via their name (like DCON-111-text-description) automatically. I know you can create the branch from within JIRA and have it be associated, but it's a bit onerous to go the page and do that every time you're making a branch. Pushing a new branch that matches the issue should do this automatically.
fields.summary: Automatic linking of branches to JIRA issues

fields.description:
Provide a way to navigate from a JIRA issue to a corresponding branch or pull request in Bitbucket or GitHub. I see that I can navigate to individual commits. I'm looking for the best way to navigate to the aggregate changes of all the commits corresponding to a JIRA issue.

From this answers post: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/202861/navigate-from-jira-to-branch-or-pull-request-in-bitbucket-or-github?page=1#202933
fields.summary: Navigate from JIRA to branch or pull request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the DVCS connector account requires write access to create the initial Webhook and OAUTH functionality. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a read only option for the DVCSaccount that will allow smart commits in one direction only.

i.e.

Bitbucket ---> JIRA
Github ---> JIRA
fields.summary: Provide read only option for the DVCS connector for smart commits only (JIRA/BitBucket).

fields.description: There is a code committed condition for Fisheye plugin but it is only for Fisheye commits. It will be helpful to also have a similar status transition condition for DVCS Connector.
fields.summary: A code commit condition for status transitions

fields.description:
Currently Stash and Bitbucket is supported for creating branches from JIRA on Dev Panel.

It would be great if you added support for Github Enterprise.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Streamlining+your+development+with+JIRA
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13414159/create-github-enterprise-branch-from-jira-issue

-Dorian
fields.summary: Ability to create a branch inside JIRA for Github Enterprise

fields.description: As developer, I want to see which branch is a commit on in development panel. When viewing, commits linked to an issue, it would be great to have the information on which branch the commits are on.
fields.summary: As developer, I want to see which branch is a commit on in development panel

fields.description: In a github smart commit, if #time is reported along with #comment, the #comment content should be posted to the work log entry's comment as well. Makes sense, or no?
fields.summary: Comments from Github smart commits should be on work log comments if #time is added

fields.description:
One of our folks just came up with a fairly awesome idea.

"Create from commit". Rough idea is that you can create a new JIRA issue from a code commit, maybe by using a #create hashtag or something like PROJECTNAME-BUG (or PROJECTNAME-TASK, etc)?
fields.summary: Create issue from commit

fields.description:
Download the GitHub Enterprise release from:

* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin
fields.summary: Add support for Github:Enterprise

fields.description: Allow admins to restrict git pulls to a connected repo unless the connected JIRA issue is in a specific workflow step, or transition.
fields.summary: Restrict git pulls based on JIRA issue state.

fields.description: Currently, DVCS connector is only able to link JIRA with BitBucket or GitHub. It would be good if there is also a similar connector that link JIRA with Microsoft Visual Source Safe (VSS).
fields.summary: Link Microsoft Visual Source Safe with JIRA

fields.description: Allow user to manually link JIRA issues to pull request. Due to limitation in editing the information in DVCS e.g. Bitbucket once a pull request has been merged, it is not possible to add missing issues in certain pull request.
fields.summary: Allow user to manually link JIRA issues to pull request

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 08 April 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; and unfortunately at the moment there aren't any plans to implement this suggestion in the next 6 months. While we think this is a great suggestion is would require a complex technical solution that would be difficult for us to implement at this time.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Megan Cook
mcook@atlassian.com
Atlassian Product Manager
{panel}

*Original request description:*
Smart commits is an excellent feature to link BitBucket commits - and the code changes - to JIRA issues. However, if a user forgets to add the issue key to the commit and then pushes upstream, it's very hard (without breaking the git repo for others) to add the issue key to the commit message. It would therefore be very useful to be able to manually link an earlier commit - and its code - to an existing JIRA issue, as if the issue key had been included in the commit message.

The commit message doesn't need to be changed, but the code changes and commit ID should be added to the issue.
fields.summary: Add ability to link previous commits to existing JIRA issues
This shall cater for the creation of Writers and MediaManagers accounts
This shall cater for multiple user roles
This shall cater for the management of an article, in terms of updating, deletion and creation

fields.description: Our company has multiple Github Enterprise installations; it looks like we can only generate an oauth pair for a single server at a time. Is there any way to use Oauth pairs for more than one server?
fields.summary: Support multiple Github Enterprise instances

fields.description:
I need the email on my account changed from george.easton@eu.nabgroup.com to george.easton@cybg.com

Also I used to be able to see the DYB project code in BitBucket but no longer can - I need access to familiarise myself with this code
fields.summary: I need the email on my account changed and access to DYB project code on BitBucket

fields.description:
I'm writing a plugin that can use an info about commits in order to provide a more precise info to end users (of course only if DVCS plugin is activated). Would you consider exposing your components (making them public) for people like me? Here are more detailed requirements:

----

*As a Plugin Developer I'd like to be able to access information about commits from DVCS plugin in order to be able to alter my plugin behaviour*

*Acceptance Criteria*
* If DVCS Plugin is enabled, it exposes its components to other plugins
* Information needed from the DVCS Plugin:
** Number of commits linked to an issue
** For each commit: its hash; commit date; list of files added/deleted/updated and lines of code that were changed; author/committer.
fields.summary: Expose DVCS components to other plugins (make them public)

fields.description:
Microsoft's Visual Studio Online (VSO) - http://www.visualstudio.com/products/what-is-visual-studio-online-vs - provides cloud-hosted source code repositories using Git or Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC). Please consider adding support for (at least) Git repositories hosted in VSO.

A REST API is available (documented at http://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/integrate/reference/reference-vso-overview-vsi.aspx) which provides access to Git commits and Service hooks are available to listen for issue key references. Authorisation is via OAuth 2.0 (see http://www.visualstudio.com/integrate/get-started/get-started-auth-oauth2-vsi).
fields.summary: Support Visual Studio Online Git repositories
As a reviewer I want to have an account so that i can review an article
As a reviewer to be able to review articles and add comments

fields.description:
In order to have better visibility into the DVCS Connector behaviour while running production we should be generating atlassian-analytics events for things like "a sync has started". This will let us easily answer questions like:

- How many syncs are currently running
- How many repositories are in an average sync
- How long syncs take on average

Etc.
fields.summary: The DVCS Connector should generate atlassian-analytics events in addition to its database audit log

fields.description:
The current dark feature {{dvcs.connector.synchronization.disabled}} disables synchronization for both Bitbucket and GitHub.

We want to introduce three new dark features:
* {{dvcs.connector.synchronization.disabled.bitbucket}}
* {{dvcs.connector.synchronization.disabled.github}}
* {{dvcs.connector.synchronization.disabled.githube}}
so that it works as followed:
||{{...disabled}}||{{...disabled.bitbucket}}||{{...disabled.github}}||{{...disabled.githube}}||Bitbucket Sync Enabled||GitHub Sync Enabled||GitHub Ent Sync Enabled||
|(/)|(/)|(/)|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
|(/)|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
|(/)|(x)|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
|(/)|(x)|(x)|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
|(x)|(/)|(/)|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
|(x)|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(/)|(/)|
|(x)|(x)|(/)|(x)|(/)|(x)|(/)|
|(x)|(x)|(x)|(/)|(/)|(/)|(x)|



Note: Make sure we update UI and controls to warn user and not allow them do things they are not supposed to do
fields.summary: Add separate dark features to disable Bitbucket and GitHub sync independently
As an Admin I want to create MediaManager accounts
